2023-01-01.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2023-01-01.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2023-01-01.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2023-01-01.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2023-01-01.name: ZooLights
2023-01-01.summary: Admission to the annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays. Reserve time slots in advance.

2023-01-01.name: New Year's Day Parade
2023-01-01.summary: Welcome the new year with a 1 p.m. parade. Everyone is welcome to march.

2023-01-06.name: SISU Ski Fest
2023-01-06.summary: This Finnish fest includes a ski expo, free kids' ski, 5K Fun Ski, 15km and 30km ski races, a free after-party at the Historic Ironwood Theatre and a free fat-bike demo on scenic bluffs and along the Montreal River.

2023-01-06.name: Bald Eagle Days
2023-01-06.summary: At the Quad Cities Expo Center, there's an environmental fair, with flying demonstrations by eagles,  hawks and owls and hourlong eagle-watching tours.

2023-01-06.name: Breezy Point Ice Fest
2023-01-06.summary: This Brainerd Lakes resort village celebrates with horse-drawn sleigh rides, an ice slide, snow golf, bonfires and kids' ice fishing.

2023-01-06.name: Ice Festival
2023-01-06.summary: There are ice-climbing and winter camping clinics, a chili cook-off, door prizes and use of demo gear in Sandstone Ice Park.

2023-01-07.name: SISU Ski Fest
2023-01-07.summary: This Finnish fest includes a ski expo, free kids' ski, 5K Fun Ski, 15km and 30km ski races, a free after-party at the Historic Ironwood Theatre and a free fat-bike demo on scenic bluffs and along the Montreal River.

2023-01-07.name: Bald Eagle Days
2023-01-07.summary: At the Quad Cities Expo Center, there's an environmental fair, with flying demonstrations by eagles,  hawks and owls and hourlong eagle-watching tours.

2023-01-07.name: Breezy Point Ice Fest

2023-01-07.name: Ice Festival
2023-01-07.summary: There are ice-climbing and winter camping clinics, a chili cook-off, door prizes and use of demo gear in Sandstone Ice Park.

2023-01-07.name: Winter Festival
2023-01-07.summary: Visit the Kickapoo Valley Reserve for horse-drawn bobsled rides, guided snowshoe and ice-cave hikes, winter games, fat-tire bike demos and a sled-dog race and weight pull.

2023-01-07.name: Gunflint Mail Run sled-dog race
2023-01-07.summary: In far northeast Minnesota, watch mushers travel two legs of 50 miles, starting and ending at the Trail Center Lodge on the Central Gunflint Trail.

2023-01-08.name: SISU Ski Fest
2023-01-08.summary: This Finnish fest includes a ski expo, free kids' ski, 5K Fun Ski, 15km and 30km ski races, a free after-party at the Historic Ironwood Theatre and a free fat-bike demo on scenic bluffs and along the Montreal River.

2023-01-19.name: World Championship Snowmobile Derby
2023-01-19.summary: Watch oval, snocross and vintage snowmobiles race in this northeast Wisconsin town, which attracts 40,000 spectators to the "Indianapolis 500 of snowmobile racing.''

2023-01-19.name: World Snow Sculpting Championship
2023-01-19.summary: Snow-sculpting teams from around the world will compete in Lowell Park.

2023-01-20.name: World Championship Snowmobile Derby
2023-01-20.summary: Watch oval, snocross and vintage snowmobiles race in this northeast Wisconsin town, which attracts 40,000 spectators to the "Indianapolis 500 of snowmobile racing.''

2023-01-20.name: World Snow Sculpting Championship

2023-01-21.name: World Championship Snowmobile Derby
2023-01-21.summary: Watch oval, snocross and vintage snowmobiles race in this northeast Wisconsin town, which attracts 40,000 spectators to the "Indianapolis 500 of snowmobile racing.''

2023-01-21.name: Bald Eagle Appreciation Days
2023-01-21.summary: There will be live-eagle presentations, Native American activities, seminars and viewing on the river in Keokuk on Saturday, and on Sunday activities will be in Montrose.

2023-01-21.name: Wisconsin Free Fishing Weekend
2023-01-21.summary: No license is needed for fishing in Wisconsin or on its side of the Mississippi River and lakes Superior and Michigan.

2023-01-21.name: World Snow Sculpting Championship
2023-01-21.summary: Snow-sculpting teams from around the world will compete in Lowell Park.

2023-01-21.name: Winterfest
2023-01-21.summary: Go on a beer and wine walk or compete in ham-throwing, log-sawing, wreath-tossing, the Amana Freezer Run/Walk or for the best beard. There will also be ice sculpting and chainsaw-carving.

2023-01-21.name: Beer & Cheese Fest
2023-01-21.summary: A celebration of Wisconsin's greatest products at Alliant Energy Center, with plenty to sample. Tickets sell out, so buy early.

2023-01-21.name: Art Shanty Projects
2023-01-21.summary: Frozen Lake Harriet hosts two dozen artist-designed ice houses and lots of fun art antics for kids and adults alike. Check for scheduled events and ice conditions.

2023-01-22.summary: Watch oval, snocross and vintage snowmobiles race in this northeast Wisconsin town, which attracts 40,000 spectators to the "Indianapolis 500 of snowmobile racing.''

2023-01-13.name: Back to Hack Winter Festival
2023-01-13.summary: The festival in this Brainerd Lakes town on the Paul Bunyan State Trail features snow sculpting, ice golf, an ice-fishing contest, penguin plunge, kids' games and Saturday fireworks.

2023-01-14.name: Back to Hack Winter Festival
2023-01-14.summary: The festival in this Brainerd Lakes town on the Paul Bunyan State Trail features snow sculpting, ice golf, an ice-fishing contest, penguin plunge, kids' games and Saturday fireworks.

2023-01-14.name: Ice Fest
2023-01-14.summary: The National Mississippi River Museum hosts this indoor-outdoor festival, which includes ice-harvest and ice-rescue demonstrations, snow sculpting, a live-raptor program and youth ice fishing.

2023-01-14.name: Bald Eagle Watching Days
2023-01-14.summary: This town along the Wisconsin River, next to a hydroelectric plant, offers guided bus tours, live birds of prey programs and kids' activities in addition to eagle viewing at overlooks staffed by volunteers.

2023-01-14.name: Take a Kid Ice Fishing Weekend
2023-01-14.summary: Take a kid younger than 16 spear- or ice-fishing this holiday weekend, and you can fish for free.

2023-01-15.name: Back to Hack Winter Festival
2023-01-15.summary: The festival in this Brainerd Lakes town on the Paul Bunyan State Trail features snow sculpting, ice golf, an ice-fishing contest, penguin plunge, kids' games and Saturday fireworks.

2023-01-18.summary: Snow-sculpting teams from around the world will compete in Lowell Park.

2023-01-26.name: Winter Games
2023-01-26.summary: This resort area in northwest Iowa will offer human sled races, flag football on ice, indoor golf, snowball drop, stein-holding, horse-drawn carriage rides, a Freeze Yer Fanny Bike Ride, keg toss and fireworks.

2023-01-26.name: Winterfest
2023-01-26.summary: In this Lake Michigan town, there's a human sled race, cardboard sled race, luau and snow-angel contest.

2023-01-26.name: Winter Carnival
2023-01-26.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2023-01-27.name: Winter Games
2023-01-27.summary: This resort area in northwest Iowa will offer human sled races, flag football on ice, indoor golf, snowball drop, stein-holding, horse-drawn carriage rides, a Freeze Yer Fanny Bike Ride, keg toss and fireworks.

2023-01-27.name: Schnee Days
2023-01-27.summary: The Snow Days festival in this town in east-central Wisconsin includes the SchneeLauf Run/Walk and such activities as a hunt for colored ice cubes, dog sledding and a chili cook-off.

2023-01-27.name: Lake Superior Ice Festival
2023-01-27.summary: On Barker's Island, there's a snow slide, ice carving, disc golf, ice racing, kids' activities and fireworks on Saturday.

2023-01-28.name: Winter Games

2023-01-28.name: Winter Fest

2023-01-28.name: Frostival
2023-01-28.summary: In this border town, events include a snow-sculpture competition, games, a snowshoe hike, marshmallow roast, snowga and free ski and snowshoe rentals.

2023-01-29.name: John Beargrease Sled Dog Marathon
2023-01-29.summary: From Duluth, marathon mushers travel to to Grand Portage and mid-distance racers to Tofte.

2023-01-29.name: Chinese Lunar New Year's Parade
2023-01-29.summary: Celebrate the Year of the Rabbit in Chinatown with a parade, marching bands and lion dancing. It starts at 1 p.m. at 24th Street and Wentworth Avenue.
